intro: Borreria arida, commonly known as desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, succulent leaves that help it conserve water. It is well adapted to hot, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils. Borreria arida is also used in traditional medicine by some indigenous communities.
